data.title: Refinery / Harvester-Husk / Mechanic-Husk-Repairing
data.body:
@ playtest : 

a harvester getting destroyed on the Refinery-unloading-patch looks like this (all other vehicles are fine)  : 
![refhuskharv](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1997864/2677679/74015020-c155-11e3-8b27-bb98ea975ab2.png)

it seems like a "harvester-husk" on a Refinery-unloading-patch is the only husk which can be repaired by a Mechanic ( does not work with other vehicles , like mamooths / tanks , etc. ) 
![mechharv](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1997864/2677691/d5a2ac52-c155-11e3-909f-a399e2675ec6.png)

data.title: More RA balance tweaks
Artillery will stop shooting at a destroyed building, even if it is under the shroud
data.body:
They will try to drive to said destroyed building if has not yet been scouted and updated yet.

<bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Template on Lua scripting with cool functions
data.body:
(wrote this to be able to put a bounty on it)

We need a Lua template and tutorial to make use of cool functions..
This way it should be easier for users to make maps, easy or advanced.

I have some ideas on what should be included, but others can also come with suggestions..

data.title: Crash after 60 minutes computing of paths
data.body:
Was testing lag caused by many oil derricks, but i made a crash instead.

I created maybe 400 infantry units and put them on one blob and then moved them nearby some building in my base; game froze and i left it open, until around 1 hour later it finally made the crash message.

Mod: RA
Map: Great Oily Divide - http://resource.openra.net/maps/610

Logs:
http://www.speedyshare.com/Uw4WV/OneHourFreezeAndCrash.7z

Maybe related to the bug: https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/4609 ?

data.title: Upgrade to .NET 4.0
data.body: The latest versions of the GeoIP, Eluant, and SDL2-CS libraries all target 4.0. This separates the .net changes from #4666, and then migrates everything to System.Lazy to remove the ugly namespace clash and unnecessary duplication.

data.title: CNC grenadiers are only occasionally effective vs infantry
data.body:
I would suggest a buff to the splash range, so that you don't need to worry about missing all the time. Currently, if the grenadiers miss, it is pretty dramatic.

data.title: CNC orcas are underpowered against what they should be powerful towards
data.body:
Orcas should be anti tank, not anti infantry. Currently, they are better vs infantry than tanks. It takes a long time for three orcas to destroy a medium tank.

<bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Crash: Attempted to finalize an undisposed DisposableAction
data.body:
I played around with queued commands with SHIFT button for whole game. I had tanja etc. Then i think i pressed some units to move bottom of the map and then it crashed (i didnt hold SHIFT when i did that IIRC).

`Red Alert Mod at Version release-20131223
Operating System: Windows (Microsoft Windows NT 6.1.7601 Service Pack 1)
Runtime Version: .NET CLR 2.0.50727.5477
Exception of type `System.InvalidOperationException`: Attempted to finalize an undisposed DisposableAction. hind (1677) reserved hpad (1528)
   at OpenRA.Mods.RA.Reservable.<Reserve>c__AnonStorey1C4.<>m__5B7()
   at System.Action.Invoke()
   at OpenRA.FileFormats.ActionQueue.PerformActions()
   at OpenRA.Game.Tick(OrderManager orderManager)
   at OpenRA.Game.Run()
   at OpenRA.Program.Run(String[] args)
   at OpenRA.Program.Main(String[] args)
`
All logs:
http://www.speedyshare.com/dfBr4/undisposed-DisposableAction.7z

Mod: RA
Map: Great Oily Divide ( link: http://resource.openra.net/maps/610 )

data.title: resource.openra.net link incorrect for front page map preview image
data.body:
The picture doesnt match the map page it opens when you click the image.

Also it shows (after a while) multiple maps on top of each other in that preview; maybe that is why the link is wrong; it belongs to some map under it?

Edit: seems like the link works correctly **sometimes**. Probably JS problem?

data.title: Units without Explosions
data.body:
while playing on the new playtest with tanya , destroying vehicles with c4 , ive noticed that a few units dont have any Explosion-Effects or Sounds when getting destroyed ... 

they just literally dissapear or turn into husks ... without any special-effects

OreTruck - with husk
Mcv         - with husk 
MineLayer 
Apc
SupplyTruck
Ranger 
TeslaTank
CronoTank 
PhaseTransporter

data.title: Units spawn in top left corner of map, revealing shroud
data.body:
Map cordon size seems to have something to do with the reveal. Can only reproduce this on maps with 1x1 cordon (and probably 2x2 / 3x3)

![capture](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/566742/2638901/fe6bd140-beb7-11e3-8632-6d00e5d5ea6f.PNG)

To reproduce:
- Pick RA map Seaside 2 or Chaos Canyon (126x126 with 1x1 cordons)
- Build a barracks anywhere
- Move camera to top left corner of the map
- Build E1/DOG and notice the fog will vanish for a brief second, and shroud will be gone. DOG reveals a bit more.

data.title: Add support for using 8-bit PNGs instead of SHPs
data.body:
All this converting back and forth between various shp/tmp file formats and palettes is quite annoying.

It would be great if there was the option to use 8-bit PNGs just like SHPs, preferably with the optional possibility to use the PNGs' own palette.

As for how to solve multiple frames, I have no idea whether [ab]using MNG, APNG or even simply 1 massive PNG containing all frames (and then telling the engine per yaml what dimensions each frame should have) is the best solution. The latter would have the highest compatibility with image editing programs, though.

Outside the legacy mods this would make things so much easier, IMO. OS SHP Builder still has a buggy(shp TS)/broken(shp TD) saving mechanism, and converting back and forth between PNG and SHP/TMP via XCC or command line is annoying as heck. To be able to just drop your edited PNG with its own palette into the bits folder and be done with it would be so much more convenient, and save modders tons of time.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/1533521-add-support-for-using-8-bit-pngs-instead-of-shps?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Chronotank, its worthless.
data.body:
Its weak, its weapon isn't anything special, and it doesn't even have enough range to chrono past base defenses. 

How do we make it more valuable? How can we give it a unique place where it can be the centerpiece to your strategy? The first thing that needs to be done is increase the range that they can chronoport, unless this has been done already since last release?

Heck even back in the original game they weren't particularly useful, so maybe they need an even greater reworking?

Allow me to throw out some crazy ideas, just for the heck of it!

1)What if chronotanks were unarmed, but could fit 1 vehicle inside of themselves? Permanently moving that vehicle to its destination but its still got limited range.

2)What if they were a single use and could move vehicles that occupy the 4 adjacent cells to itself? 
So its like the chronosphere, but only one use and 1 less vehicle can be moved and it costs almost as much as a chronosphere.

3)What if they got increased chrono range if you had more chronotanks in the same area?
Say you had a group of 10 chronotanks, now they have enough range to chrono across a third of the map! 
Maximum bonus on it too, so any more then 10 doesn't increase the range more.

4)What if once charged up they could fire chrono rockets? The rockets would be teleported to the target giving increased range for a few seconds?

<bountysource-plugin>

---

Want to back this issue? **[Place a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/1531714-chronotank-its-worthless?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Upgrade to SDL 2.0.3
data.body:
This upgrades our SDL2 renderer to 2.0.3, which adds support for (among other things) proper spaces integration on OSX:

![osx-spaces](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/167819/2631426/bb912848-be58-11e3-9a00-cdec9234cd49.png)

This also fixes the awkward file naming of the SDL2-CS wrapper.

data.title: RenderLandingCraft doesn't do an IsInMap check
data.body: This causes it to open its doors when on the edge of the map, since most maps have grass cordons.

data.title: Added a counterpart to the Makefile for Windows users
data.body: Purposely named make.cmd and make.ps1 so we can tell people to use 'make blahblahblah' and have it work, regardless of their platform.

data.title: Make mrj not jam allied missiles
data.body: Encourages mrj use with chronotanks etc

data.title: Revert removing TakeCover from Shock Trooper and make them Crushable
data.body: SHOK are too strong with this experimental change.

data.title: Harvesters cause 90% of lag?
data.body:
I had been wondering for years, why big maps lag so much.

Today i played 1v1 on big map, and when enemy ragequitted, it was still laggy. So i started selling my refineries and stopped all my harvesters. Suddenly, the game lag was almost totally gone!

RA mod.

Edit: Today I noticed even just the refineries cause lag? Is that possible? I killed all ore trucks, but didnt reduce any lag (had only 2), so i killed the refineries too, and then there was a lot less lag.

data.body: ![screenshot001](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1732773/2625086/d944f9c0-bd7a-11e3-9121-8f91102eb81c.png)

data.title: Superweapon tweaks
data.body:
- Ion cannon and nuke (TD+RA) will now reveal the shroud when they strike.
- Nuke launch -> detonate delay is now independent of map, and configurable by mods/maps.
- Nuke beacons now stick around until (just before) detonation.

data.title: Made hay bales non C4 targetable
data.body: while testing https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/5063

data.title: Clear Shroud cheat should also reveal hidden FrozenActors.
data.body: This would simplify testing a lot. Right now you need to disable shroud, unpause the game for at least one tick (in C&C), and then disable it again.

data.title: Restrict commando weapon to infantry
data.body:
This matches the fix we did to Tanya a while back.
Supersedes #5060.

data.title: Bug: Could not target turret
data.body:
http://imgur.com/cHpoUBg

When playing multiplayer, was not able to target enemy turret with my infantry.

Was thinking maybe this was because of its location at the head of the bridge?

data.title: Static defenses should reveal their location after firing
data.body:
Currently if a turret opens fire on you, but it is under fog, you cannot see its location. I think that it would be better if turrets would become visible after they fire upon you, like in the original.

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/1499105-static-defenses-should-reveal-their-location-after-firing?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: make sniper not target buildings, vehicles
data.body:
Sniper currently shoots at buildings when auto-attacking. This seems kind of wrong, given that he can blow them up with a C4 charge.

Sniper is probably also wasting his ammo by shooting at vehicles when the enemy is a mix of vehicles + infantry. Since the Sniper costs $1000, you would want him to kill some infantry before dying, to get your money's worth.

Part of the reason proposed change is that sniper is not useful when fighting a mix of vehicles + infantry (e.g. end-game light tanks + chem warriors). Sniper might be helpful in a mix, but currently wastes a lot of its ammo on vehicles, making it definitely not worth the money.

data.title: "Pillbox" Force Fire
data.body:
so the turret/flame turret behaved fine, i could change targets whenever i wanted
but pillboxes ALWAYS changed back to their original target , no matter what

(not force fire specific, but pillbox specific)

data.title: Ion Cannon should have camera
data.body: Right now when you fire the Ion Cannon into the shroud, you cannot see the result. Since it's a weapon fired from a satellite which is flying over, I think there should be a camera that gives you vision in the area for several seconds afterwards.
